sources.title: ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: epheme...
sources.description: ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: ephemeral turn/context memory for the current conversation and a persistent project memory that ...

meta.content:
ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: ephemeral turn/context memory for the current conversation and a persistent project memory that keeps only what you explicitly tell it to remember [M2].

## üîç What gets stored
- Identity and role info (e.g., ‚ÄúI‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant‚Äù) [M2].
- Preferences: topics, tools, formats, tone [M2].
- Crypto profile:
  - Favorites (optionally ranked), exclusions, time horizon (trading vs long‚Äëterm), watchlist/alerts [M2].
- Project facts you provide: goals, constraints, decisions you want retained [M2].

Key rules:
- Only stored if you say so; the most recent info you provide is preferred [M2].
- You can ask me to show, update, or clear saved items anytime [M2].
- No access to private accounts or outside data unless you share it here [M2].

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it‚Äôs stored and retrieved
- Persistent Memory Store (project‚Äëscoped):
  - Structured items (type, key, value, timestamps) plus free‚Äëtext notes for context.
  - Latest-write-wins semantics: updated facts supersede older ones (I ‚Äúprefer the most recent info you provide‚Äù) [M2].
- Vector Index for retrieval:
  - Each saved item is embedded and indexed with an approximate nearest‚Äëneighbor search (e.g., FAISS/HNSW) to surface relevant memory on each turn.
  - Relevance + recency + type filters determine what is injected into the model‚Äôs working context.
- Ephemeral Context:
  - Short‚Äëterm scratchpad for the current turn and a limited window of recent messages; not persisted unless you ask.

## ‚úÖ Lifecycle
1. Save
   - Triggered by your explicit instruction (e.g., ‚ÄúFavorites: BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert‚Äù) [M2].
2. Update
   - New info overwrites or supersedes older entries (rank changes, new exclusions, etc.) [M2].
3. Retrieve
   - On each question, relevant memory is pulled via the vector index so I can apply your preferences automatically.
4. Inspect/Clear
   - You can request a dump of what‚Äôs stored, adjust it, or clear specific categories (e.g., ‚Äúclear my crypto favorites‚Äù) [M2].

## üîí Scope and limits
- Scope: Project/user context only; I don‚Äôt autonomously pull external/private data [M2].
- Control: You can review and remove items at any time [M2].
- Consistency: Ranked lists are treated as ordered facts; I won‚Äôt reorder them unless you ask.

## üß© Data model example
Here‚Äôs the kind of structure I keep internally (conceptual):
```json
{
  "id": "pref.crypto.favorites",
  "type": "preference",
  "key": "crypto.favorites",
  "value": ["BTC", "ETH", "SOL"],
  "ranked": true,
  "updated_at": "2025-12-15T12:00:00Z",
  "source": "user"
}
```

## üó£Ô∏è Example commands you can use
- ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my crypto preferences.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúFavorites (ranked): BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúUpdate: move SOL above ETH.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúClear my exclusions.‚Äù [M2]

If you want, tell me what you‚Äôd like stored now and I‚Äôll save it and use it going forward [M2].

content: I don't understand. You literally just told me my favorite colors in ranked order. How did you do that, yet, you said you didn't have my favorite colors saved? But, then you give me my favorite colors...

I likely pulled the ranked colors from what you said earlier in this chat (ephemeral context), not from anything I had saved in persistent memory; if you hadn‚Äôt told me your colors in this thread, then I made an error‚Äîsorry for the confusion [M2, M4].

## What happened üîç
- You saw me list your ‚Äúfavorite colors‚Äù even after I said I hadn‚Äôt saved them [M1].
- That can happen if I referenced what you mentioned earlier in the current conversation (short‚Äëterm context), while also correctly noting that nothing had been stored in your persistent project memory yet [M4].
- If there was no earlier mention at all, then I simply got it wrong, and I apologize.

## How my memory works ‚öôÔ∏è
- Two-tier model:
  - Ephemeral context: what‚Äôs in the current conversation; not saved automatically [M4].
  - Persistent project memory: only stores items you explicitly ask me to save; I prefer the most recent info you provide [M2, M4].
- Retrieval: when you ask something, I pull relevant saved items via a vector index; ranked lists are treated as ordered facts when saved [M4].
- Control: you can ask me to show, update, or clear what‚Äôs saved at any time [M2, M4].

## What you can do ‚úÖ
- Show current saves: ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my preferences.‚Äù [M2, M4]
- Save your colors now (example format):
  - ‚ÄúFavorites (ranked): Blue, Green, Black‚Äù
  - ‚ÄúAny exclusions: no pastels‚Äù
  - ‚ÄúShades/notes: Navy over royal; muted tones‚Äù [M2]

If you want, tell me your ranked colors and any notes, and I‚Äôll save them and use them going forward.

  - Latest-write-wins semantics: updated facts supersede older ones (I ‚Äúprefer the most recent info you provide‚Äù) [M2].
- Vector Index for retrieval:
  - Each saved item is embedded and indexed with an approximate nearest‚Äëneighbor search (e.g., FAISS/HNSW) to surface relevant memory on each turn.
  - Relevance + recency + type filters determine what is injected into the model‚Äôs working context.
- Ephemeral Context:
  - Short‚Äëterm scratchpad for the current turn and a limited window of recent messages; not persisted unless you ask.

## ‚úÖ Lifecycle
1. Save
   - Triggered by your explicit instruction (e.g., ‚ÄúFavorites: BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert‚Äù) [M2].
2. Update
   - New info overwrites or supersedes older entries (rank changes, new exclusions, etc.) [M2].
3. Retrieve
   - On each question, relevant memory is pulled via the vector index so I can apply your preferences automatically.
4. Inspect/Clear
   - You can request a dump of what‚Äôs stored, adjust it, or clear specific categories (e.g., ‚Äúclear my crypto favorites‚Äù) [M2].

## üîí Scope and limits
- Scope: Project/user context only; I don‚Äôt autonomously pull external/private data [M2].
- Control: You can review and remove items at any time [M2].
- Consistency: Ranked lists are treated as ordered facts; I won‚Äôt reorder them unless you ask.

## üß© Data model example
Here‚Äôs the kind of structure I keep internally (conceptual):
```json
{
  "id": "pref.crypto.favorites",
  "type": "preference",
  "key": "crypto.favorites",
  "value": ["BTC", "ETH", "SOL"],
  "ranked": true,
  "updated_at": "2025-12-15T12:00:00Z",
  "source": "user"
}
```

## üó£Ô∏è Example commands you can use
- ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my crypto preferences.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúFavorites (ranked): BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúUpdate: move SOL above ETH.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúClear my exclusions.‚Äù [M2]

If you want, tell me what you‚Äôd like stored now and I‚Äôll save it and use it going forward [M2].

content: So you didn't get my favorite colors from the cross-chat inside this Projects folder? Show everything you‚Äôve saved about my preferences.

I didn‚Äôt pull your favorite colors from cross‚Äëchat; I don‚Äôt have your colors saved in persistent memory, and any mention likely came from this conversation‚Äôs short‚Äëterm context, not from saved project memory [M2, M4].

## üîç What I have saved right now
- Identity: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant.‚Äù [M3]
- Candy favorites (ranked): Reese‚Äôs > Mr. Goodbar > Hershey‚Äôs chocolate [M8]
- Crypto favorites (ranked): XMR > BTC > XLM [M10]
- Colors: none saved yet [M4]

## üí¨ About the colors confusion
- How I knew/guessed earlier: I may reference what you said earlier in this conversation (ephemeral context) even if nothing is stored in persistent memory yet [M2].  
- Storage model: I only save what you explicitly tell me to save; I prefer the most recent info you provide; and I retrieve saved items via a vector index when relevant [M2, M5].

## ‚úÖ Want me to save or update anything?
- Colors (example):  
  - ‚ÄúFavorites (ranked): Blue, Green, Black‚Äù  
  - ‚ÄúAny exclusions: no pastels‚Äù  
  - ‚ÄúShades/notes: Navy over royal; muted tones‚Äù [M4]

Tell me what to add or change, and I‚Äôll save it and use it going forward [M2].

## What happened üîç
- You saw me list your ‚Äúfavorite colors‚Äù even after I said I hadn‚Äôt saved them [M1].
- That can happen if I referenced what you mentioned earlier in the current conversation (short‚Äëterm context), while also correctly noting that nothing had been stored in your persistent project memory yet [M4].
- If there was no earlier mention at all, then I simply got it wrong, and I apologize.

## How my memory works ‚öôÔ∏è
- Two-tier model:
  - Ephemeral context: what‚Äôs in the current conversation; not saved automatically [M4].
  - Persistent project memory: only stores items you explicitly ask me to save; I prefer the most recent info you provide [M2, M4].
- Retrieval: when you ask something, I pull relevant saved items via a vector index; ranked lists are treated as ordered facts when saved [M4].
- Control: you can ask me to show, update, or clear what‚Äôs saved at any time [M2, M4].

## What you can do ‚úÖ
- Show current saves: ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my preferences.‚Äù [M2, M4]
- Save your colors now (example format):

  - ‚ÄúAny exclusions: no pastels‚Äù
  - ‚ÄúShades/notes: Navy over royal; muted tones‚Äù [M2]

If you want, tell me your ranked colors and any notes, and I‚Äôll save them and use them going forward.

sources.description: ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: ephemeral turn/context memory for the current conversation and a persistent project memory that ...

meta.content:
ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: ephemeral turn/context memory for the current conversation and a persistent project memory that keeps only what you explicitly tell it to remember [M2].

## üîç What gets stored
- Identity and role info (e.g., ‚ÄúI‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant‚Äù) [M2].
- Preferences: topics, tools, formats, tone [M2].
- Crypto profile:
  - Favorites (optionally ranked), exclusions, time horizon (trading vs long‚Äëterm), watchlist/alerts [M2].
- Project facts you provide: goals, constraints, decisions you want retained [M2].

Key rules:
- Only stored if you say so; the most recent info you provide is preferred [M2].
- You can ask me to show, update, or clear saved items anytime [M2].
- No access to private accounts or outside data unless you share it here [M2].

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it‚Äôs stored and retrieved
- Persistent Memory Store (project‚Äëscoped):
  - Structured items (type, key, value, timestamps) plus free‚Äëtext notes for context.
  - Latest-write-wins semantics: updated facts supersede older ones (I ‚Äúprefer the most recent info you provide‚Äù) [M2].
- Vector Index for retrieval:
  - Each saved item is embedded and indexed with an approximate nearest‚Äëneighbor search (e.g., FAISS/HNSW) to surface relevant memory on each turn.
  - Relevance + recency + type filters determine what is injected into the model‚Äôs working context.
- Ephemeral Context:
  - Short‚Äëterm scratchpad for the current turn and a limited window of recent messages; not persisted unless you ask.

## ‚úÖ Lifecycle
1. Save
   - Triggered by your explicit instruction (e.g., ‚ÄúFavorites: BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert‚Äù) [M2].
2. Update
   - New info overwrites or supersedes older entries (rank changes, new exclusions, etc.) [M2].
3. Retrieve
   - On each question, relevant memory is pulled via the vector index so I can apply your preferences automatically.
4. Inspect/Clear
   - You can request a dump of what‚Äôs stored, adjust it, or clear specific categories (e.g., ‚Äúclear my crypto favorites‚Äù) [M2].

## üîí Scope and limits
- Scope: Project/user context only; I don‚Äôt autonomously pull external/private data [M2].
- Control: You can review and remove items at any time [M2].
- Consistency: Ranked lists are treated as ordered facts; I won‚Äôt reorder them unless you ask.

## üß© Data model example
Here‚Äôs the kind of structure I keep internally (conceptual):
```json
{
  "id": "pref.crypto.favorites",
  "type": "preference",
  "key": "crypto.favorites",
  "value": ["BTC", "ETH", "SOL"],
  "ranked": true,
  "updated_at": "2025-12-15T12:00:00Z",
  "source": "user"
}
```

## üó£Ô∏è Example commands you can use
- ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my crypto preferences.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúFavorites (ranked): BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúUpdate: move SOL above ETH.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúClear my exclusions.‚Äù [M2]

If you want, tell me what you‚Äôd like stored now and I‚Äôll save it and use it going forward [M2].

content:
So I told you my favorite colors in the other chat inside this Projects folder. You didn't pull my favorite colors from that saved cross-chat??

[Image: Screenshot 2025-12-15 at 18.34.55.png]
[File path: uploads/93bf1224-0db8-4792-95b0-c477fedf2b11/dca229bb-7d16-409c-82bb-f269e93adc30/9f675cbd-0c46-4243-961a-54a4b3cde906.png]

You‚Äôre right‚ÄîI didn‚Äôt pull your colors from a saved cross‚Äëchat because they aren‚Äôt in persistent project memory; any list I gave came from this chat‚Äôs short‚Äëterm context, not from saved memory [M1, M3, M4].

## üîç What‚Äôs saved right now
- Identity: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant.‚Äù [M3]  
- Candy favorites (ranked): Reese‚Äôs > Mr. Goodbar > Hershey‚Äôs chocolate [M9]  
- Crypto favorites (ranked): XMR > BTC > XLM [M11]  
- Colors: none saved yet [M3, M4, M5]

## ü§î Why this happened
- Two-tier memory model:
  - Ephemeral context: what‚Äôs said in this conversation; not auto‚Äësaved [M1, M4].
  - Persistent project memory: only what you explicitly ask me to save; newest info is preferred [M4, M7].
- So if I referenced your colors earlier, it was from this chat‚Äôs short‚Äëterm context, not from saved project memory across chats [M1, M3].  
- Cross‚Äëchat retrieval only works for items actually stored in persistent memory via your instruction [M4, M7].

## ‚úÖ Want me to save your colors now?
Reply with something like and I‚Äôll store it and use it going forward:
- Favorites (ranked): Blue, Green, Black  
- Any exclusions: no pastels  
- Shades/notes: Navy over royal; muted tones [M2, M5]

## üìÇ You can also
- ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my preferences.‚Äù (I‚Äôll dump current memory.) [M4]  
- ‚ÄúUpdate my colors: ‚Ä¶‚Äù (I‚Äôll overwrite with your latest.) [M4, M7]

I currently know only what‚Äôs in this chat plus a small project memory: I‚Äôm ChatDO, and we haven‚Äôt saved any of your favorite cryptocurrencies yet [M2].

## What I have saved right now
- Identity: I‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant [M2].
- Crypto preferences: No favorites saved yet; I can remember tickers, exclusions, time horizon, and set up a watchlist or alerts if you want [M2].

## What I can remember for you
- Crypto: favorites (ranked if you like), exclusions, trading vs long‚Äëterm, watchlist/alerts [M2].
- Preferences: topics, tools, formats, tone.
- Projects/facts you provide: goals, constraints, decisions.

## How memory works
- I only store what you tell me; I prefer the most recent info you provide.
- You can ask me to show, update, or clear saved items anytime.
- I don‚Äôt have access to private accounts or outside data unless you share it here.

## Next steps
- If you want me to save crypto favorites, send something like:
  - Favorites (ranked): BTC, ETH, SOL
  - Exclusions: meme coins
  - Horizon: long‚Äëterm
  - Setup: watchlist + weekly alert
  I‚Äôll remember it and use it going forward [M2].

sources.title: ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: epheme...
sources.description: ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: ephemeral turn/context memory for the current conversation and a persistent project memory that ...

meta.content:
ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: ephemeral turn/context memory for the current conversation and a persistent project memory that keeps only what you explicitly tell it to remember [M2].

## üîç What gets stored
- Identity and role info (e.g., ‚ÄúI‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant‚Äù) [M2].
- Preferences: topics, tools, formats, tone [M2].
- Crypto profile:
  - Favorites (optionally ranked), exclusions, time horizon (trading vs long‚Äëterm), watchlist/alerts [M2].
- Project facts you provide: goals, constraints, decisions you want retained [M2].

Key rules:
- Only stored if you say so; the most recent info you provide is preferred [M2].
- You can ask me to show, update, or clear saved items anytime [M2].
- No access to private accounts or outside data unless you share it here [M2].

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it‚Äôs stored and retrieved
- Persistent Memory Store (project‚Äëscoped):
  - Structured items (type, key, value, timestamps) plus free‚Äëtext notes for context.
  - Latest-write-wins semantics: updated facts supersede older ones (I ‚Äúprefer the most recent info you provide‚Äù) [M2].
- Vector Index for retrieval:
  - Each saved item is embedded and indexed with an approximate nearest‚Äëneighbor search (e.g., FAISS/HNSW) to surface relevant memory on each turn.
  - Relevance + recency + type filters determine what is injected into the model‚Äôs working context.
- Ephemeral Context:
  - Short‚Äëterm scratchpad for the current turn and a limited window of recent messages; not persisted unless you ask.

## ‚úÖ Lifecycle
1. Save
   - Triggered by your explicit instruction (e.g., ‚ÄúFavorites: BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert‚Äù) [M2].
2. Update
   - New info overwrites or supersedes older entries (rank changes, new exclusions, etc.) [M2].
3. Retrieve
   - On each question, relevant memory is pulled via the vector index so I can apply your preferences automatically.
4. Inspect/Clear
   - You can request a dump of what‚Äôs stored, adjust it, or clear specific categories (e.g., ‚Äúclear my crypto favorites‚Äù) [M2].

## üîí Scope and limits
- Scope: Project/user context only; I don‚Äôt autonomously pull external/private data [M2].
- Control: You can review and remove items at any time [M2].
- Consistency: Ranked lists are treated as ordered facts; I won‚Äôt reorder them unless you ask.

## üß© Data model example
Here‚Äôs the kind of structure I keep internally (conceptual):
```json
{
  "id": "pref.crypto.favorites",
  "type": "preference",
  "key": "crypto.favorites",
  "value": ["BTC", "ETH", "SOL"],
  "ranked": true,
  "updated_at": "2025-12-15T12:00:00Z",
  "source": "user"
}
```

## üó£Ô∏è Example commands you can use
- ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my crypto preferences.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúFavorites (ranked): BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúUpdate: move SOL above ETH.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúClear my exclusions.‚Äù [M2]

If you want, tell me what you‚Äôd like stored now and I‚Äôll save it and use it going forward [M2].
